Definitions.English: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.

Example Sentence.English: She felt happy when she saw the children playing.
Example Sentence.Korean: 그녀는 아이들이 놀고 있는 것을 보고 행복함을 느꼈다.

English.Noun: An intense feeling of deep affection.
English.Verb: Feel deep affection or sexual love for (someone).

Etymology.Root: Love (Old English lufu, of Germanic origin)

English.Noun: Their love for their children was evident.

Word Family.Lover [noun] 연인: A person who loves someone or is loved by someone.

Definitions.English: To be made up or composed of something.

Etymology.Root: Consist (Late Latin consistere, from com- 'together' + sistere 'stand')

Example Sentence.English: The committee consists of five members.
Example Sentence.Korean: 위원회는 다섯 명의 멤버로 구성되어 있다.

Word Family.Consistency [noun] 일관성: Conformity in the application of something.
Word Family.Consistent [adjective] 일관된: Acting or done in the same way over time.

Synonyms and Antonyms.Synonyms: Comprise, be composed of, be made up of
